name: Cicada Market
excerpt: Vastly better than the city-centre Hua Hin Night Market, this popular place 3.5km to the south is a fun mix of food, shopping and performing arts. It's…
detail_description:
Vastly better than the city-centre Hua Hin Night Market, this popular place 3.5km to the south is a fun mix of food, shopping and performing arts. It's not a high-sell environment; rather it's a very relaxed shopping experience. Many artists come to sell their handmade home decor and clothes, and there's food from Thailand and beyond. Live entertainment hits the stage from 8.30pm and there are buskers all around.
The last green sŏrng·tăa·ou back to the city passes about 9pm.

name: Hat Sai Noi
excerpt: A small resort and a couple of restaurants operate here. Weekends bring the expected crowds, but it's fairly quiet on weekdays.

name: Jao Mae Tubtim Shrine
excerpt: This Chinese temple is built on the city's namesake 'Stone Head'. It's a pleasant place to get a view of the seaside.
